titleStmt.title: The army harmelesse: or, A dispassionat and sober discussion of the late and present proceedings of the army, under the command of His Excellencie, Sir Thomas Fairfax. Wherein the equity and unblamableness of the said proceedings are demonstratively asserted, upon undenyable principles and maximes, as well of reason, as religion.
titleStmt.author: Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Pounset, and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the Hand and Bible, at the lower end of Budge-row neere Dowgate.,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Goodwin; "Attribution uncertain; [McAlpin collection copy] bound in a volume marked 'Goodwin's Tracts'"--McAlpin Catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the signe of the Hand
the lower end of Budge-row neere Dowgate.
